Package neural_network

Class Perceptron

java.lang.Object
neural_network.Perceptron
public class Perceptron
extends java.lang.Object
Perceptron class, simulate a single neuron,
Version:
1.0
Author:
physic dev
See Also:
what is a Perceptron ?

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    float learningRate
    the amount of modification by train,
    higher value result in learning faster but with less precision

    the standard value of this variable is usualy around 0.01 or 0.001
    float output
    output value of the perceptron

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Perceptron()
    create a new basic perceptron with 2 inputs

    create a new perceptron with L inputs
    Perceptron​(int L, utilities.functions ActFun)
    create a new perceptron with L inputs

    load data from file an addapt the percetron size to the data
    java.lang.String PrintWeight()
    Return a String containing all weight value (including the bias)
    void randomize()
    randomize weight and biais with value between -1 and 1, this methods reset the experience variable because the perceptron is "brainwashed"
    void randomize​(float start, float end)
    randomize weight and biais with custom range, this methods reset the experience variable because the perceptron is "brainwashed"

    save data in a special file.

    change the activation function of the neural network

    assign custom activation function to the perceptron. usefull if your activation function isn't in the utilities library.
    void setCustomActivation​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> Activation, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> Derivative, boolean use)
    assign custom activation function to the perceptron. usefull if your activation function isn't in the utilities library.
    void setInput​(java.lang.Object In)
    assign input valeu to the perceptron
    void strictLoad​(java.lang.String path)
    load data from file , fail if the perceptron size doesn't match the data in the file
    java.lang.String toString()
    Return a String containing informations about the Perceptron.
    informations contain in this representation are : number of inputs experience learningRate the used activation function
    void train​(float target)
    train the Perceptron with its actual output.
    The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
    void train​(java.lang.Object[] dataBase, float[] target)
    compute the Perceptron output then train it for every item of the array.
    The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
    void train​(java.lang.Object[] dataBase, float[] target, int train_number)
    compute the Perceptron output then train it X times with random input from the database.
    The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
    void train​(java.lang.Object In, float target)
    compute the Perceptron output then train it.
    The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
    void XavierInit()
    randomize weight and biais with the xavier initialisation,this methods reset the experience variable because the perceptron is "brainwashed"

    randomize weight and biais with the xavier initialisation,this methods reset the experience variable because the perceptron is "brainwashed"

  • Constructor Details

    • Perceptron

      public Perceptron​(int L, utilities.functions ActFun) throws java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      create a new perceptron with L inputs
      Parameters:
      L - the number of perceptron's input
      ActFun - the activation function (if you want to assign custom activation function, you must use another method after the constructor)
      Throws:
      java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - if L is negative
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if L is null
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      Perceptron(int), Perceptron()

    • Perceptron

      public Perceptron​(int L)

      Parameters:
      L - the number of perceptron's input
      Throws:
      java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - if L is negative
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if L is null
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      Perceptron(int, functions), Perceptron()

  • Method Details

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      return the Perceptron's number of input
      Returns:
      the inputLength
      Since:
      1.0

    • getXp

      public int getXp()
      experience variable increased every time the perceptron is trained.
      this variable is reset to 0 when the perceptron is randomized or redeclared
      Returns:
      the number of time the perceptron trained
      Since:
      1.0

    • getActFunction

      public java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> getActFunction()

      the activation function
      Since:

      See Also:

    • Custom

      public void Custom​(boolean use) throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      select the activation the perceptron use.
      Parameters:
      use - true if the Perceptron must use the custom activation function, else false
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException

    • CustomUsed

      public boolean CustomUsed()

    • setActFunction

      public void setActFunction​(utilities.functions fun)
      change the activation function of the neural network
      Parameters:
      fun - the new activation function
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      setCustomActivation(Function, Function), setCustomActivation(Function, Function, boolean), getDerFunction(), getActFunction()

    • setCustomActivation

      public void setCustomActivation​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> Activation, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> Derivative, boolean use)
      assign custom activation function to the perceptron. usefull if your activation function isn't in the utilities library.
      Parameters:
      Activation - the activation function
      Derivative - the derivative function .Warning ! the derivative variable are the result of the function not its input
      use - true if the Perceptron must use the custom activation function, else false
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      setActFunction(functions), setCustomActivation(Function, Function), getDerFunction(), getActFunction()

    • setCustomActivation

      public void setCustomActivation​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> Activation, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> Derivative)
      assign custom activation function to the perceptron. usefull if your activation function isn't in the utilities library.
      Parameters:
      Activation - the activation function
      Derivative - the derivative function .Warning ! the derivative variable are the result of the function not its input
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      setActFunction(functions), setCustomActivation(Function, Function,use), getDerFunction(), getActFunction()

    • randomize

      public void randomize​(float start, float end)
      randomize weight and biais with custom range, this methods reset the experience variable because the perceptron is "brainwashed"
      Parameters:
      start - the minimum value of range
      end - the maximum value of range
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      randomize()

    • randomize

      public void randomize()
      randomize weight and biais with value between -1 and 1, this methods reset the experience variable because the perceptron is "brainwashed"
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      randomize(float, float)

    • XavierInit

      public void XavierInit​(int n)
      randomize weight and biais with the xavier initialisation,this methods reset the experience variable because the perceptron is "brainwashed"
      Parameters:
      n - the parameter of the xavier distribution
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      XavierInit(), randomize()

    • XavierInit

      public void XavierInit()
      randomize weight and biais with the xavier initialisation,this methods reset the experience variable because the perceptron is "brainwashed"
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      XavierInit(int), randomize()

      public void setInput​(java.lang.Object In) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      assign input valeu to the perceptron
      Parameters:
      In - the Input data
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input data aren't Matrix or float array
      IndexOutOfBoundException - if the input data has not the same size as the perceptron

      1.0

    • train

      public void train​(float target)
      train the Perceptron with its actual output.
      The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
      Parameters:
      target - the wanted output
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      train(Object, float), train(Object[], float[]), train(Object[], float[], int)

    • train

      public void train​(java.lang.Object In, float target)
      compute the Perceptron output then train it.
      The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
      Parameters:
      In - the Input data
      target - the wanted output
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      train(float), train(Object[], float[]), train(Object[], float[], int)

    • train

      public void train​(java.lang.Object[] dataBase, float[] target) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      compute the Perceptron output then train it for every item of the array.
      The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
      Parameters:
      dataBase - the Inputs database
      target - the wanted output array (one for each input from the database)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the target array doesn't match the database array
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      train(float), train(Object, float), train(Object[], float[], int)

    • train

      public void train​(java.lang.Object[] dataBase, float[] target, int train_number) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      compute the Perceptron output then train it X times with random input from the database.
      The Perceptron train by changing its weights to get an output closer to the target the next time.
      Parameters:
      dataBase - the Inputs database
      target - the wanted output array (one for each input from the database)
      X - the number of train
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the target array doesn't match the database array
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      train(float), train(Object, float), train(Object[], float[])

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Return a String containing informations about the Perceptron.
        informations contain in this representation are :
      • number of inputs
      • experience
      • learningRate
      • the used activation function
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the String representation of the Perceptron
      Since:
      1.0

    • PrintWeight

      public java.lang.String PrintWeight()
      Return a String containing all weight value (including the bias)
      Returns:
      a string containing the weights values
      Since:
      1.0

    • save

      public void save​(java.lang.String path)
      save data in a special file.

      the file contain :

      • a header containing :
        • a begining of file : "PerceptronDataFile :" to indicate the nature of the file
        • the number of input
        • the perceptron experience
      • the weights (and biais) values
      • a end of file "==>" to indicate the file was writed correctly

      Parameters:
      path - of the file
      Since:
      1.0

    • load

      public void load​(java.lang.String path)
      load data from file an addapt the percetron size to the data
      Parameters:
      path - of the file
      Since:
      1.0

    • strictLoad

      public void strictLoad​(java.lang.String path)
      load data from file , fail if the perceptron size doesn't match the data in the file
      Parameters:
      path - of the file
      Since:
      1.0
